column2: ENGLISH

When preparing a feast even more important than deciding the foodstuff is selecting what drinks to serve. There are so many choices - beer, mead, spirit, cordial, vodka or perhaps even fine wines from Toussaint.
I will have best drinks from all the world.
I will order the best drinks from nearby taverns.
I don't want to spend too much on drinks.
I have given the orders for a Great Feast to be hosted in [Root.Location.GetName]. Let the preparations begin...
And all my vassals will be there...
The guests has finally arrived! All is ready, the cooks have worked day and night preparing the food, and the servants have scoured the cellars looking for drinks to put on table.
Welcome to my feast!
is greeted by [Root.GetTitledFirstName]

[From.GetTitledFirstName] greeted us warmly to [From.GetHerHis] feast, food was served and the best alcohol was brought  from cellars - Toussaint wine, Redanian spirit and of course mead brewed by the greatest dwarven masters.
Thank you for having us!

Much thought and consideration had been put into the courses served at [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]'s feast, but it paled compared to the drinks. The drinks put on table were magnificent, each better than previous and everytig was topped by mead brewed after traditional dwarven recipes
These drinks are heavenly!
People are in poverty and you spend so much for some drinks?
I will just keep quiet.

The courses and drinks at the feast were few but palatable. We were served the best local drinks, but nothing I couldn't get in local taverns. I had expected [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] to serve something more extraordinary at [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] feast.
The drinks is great, [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName]!
Where's the Toussaint wine?
This is good enough for me.

Instead of the food and drinks I had thought [Root.Liege.GetTitledFirstName] would serve at [Root.Liege.GetHerHis] feast, we were served just some beer and food that befitted much poorer [Root.Liege.GetManWoman]'s table.
The dinner reflects your temperance, well done!
[This.GetTitledFirstName] is glad [Root.GetTitledFirstName] liked the food at the feast
Is this what you serve your guests? Shame on you!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] complaints about the feast irritates [This.GetTitledFirstName]
It is not my place to criticise [Root.Liege.GetTitle].

[From.GetTitledFirstName] spoke up and told everyone how great the courses at my feast was. I was really glad someone was kind enough to say something nice, given how hard I had worked to ensure that food and drinks was the best part of the feast.
That was well spoken, thank you.

Some of my guests did not seem satisfied with the courses I served, but I would never have thought one of them would have complained out loud! [From.GetTitledFirstName] said a lot of nasty stuff about the drinks and I couldn't help but feel irritated.
If you don't have something nice to say, shut up!
You send out invitations to your vassals for the celebration of Velen.

Velen is a traditional elven festival held to honor the nature for the autumn harvest and the fruits it has given. The festival is held during the eight and last savaed of the elven calendar and is considered last celebration of the year.
Send the invitations.
Invitation to the Velen celebration dinner is sent.
You have been invited to join your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], to celebrate Velen this year.
How kind!
You accept the invitation.
Unfortunately, I have other plans.
You decline the invitation.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused your invitation to celebrate Velen, claiming [From.GetSheHe] has other plans.
I see.

The Velen celebration has begun. It will last for a one day and night. The fetivities are a feast where the food are made from this years harvest and sacrifice honoring the nature for this year's harvest . After the celebration has ended, the last savaed of the calendar will start.
Ceadmil.
The Velen celebration lasted untill dawn, but all good things must end. Your vassals return home, but most seem to agree that the celebration was well worth the trip.
Feainn va faill.
The Velen celebration lasted untill dawn, but all good things must end. You return home, but you and most of the other guests seem to agree that the celebration was well worth the trip.
Feainn va faill.
You send out invitations to your vassals for the celebration of Birke.

Velen is a traditional elven festival held during the spring, the main purpose of the festival is to symbolizes birth and growth - in nature and otherwise . The festival is the first day of fourth savaed of the elven calendar.
Send the invitations.
Invitation to the Birke celebration dinner is sent.
You have been invited to join your liege, [From.GetTitledFirstName], to celebrate Birke this year.
How kind!
Unfortunately, I have other plans.
[From.GetTitledFirstName] has refused your invitation to celebrate Birke, claiming [From.GetSheHe] has other plans.
I see.

The Birke celebration has begun. The celebration is held to have bontiful harvest in the coming year, it includes a small feast and of course a sacrifices - a handful of grains, fruits or other products from last year's remaining harvest.
Ceadmil.

The Birke celebration ended a few hours before dawn, so that you and your visitors can tomorrow rise early. Your vassals return home, but most seem to agree that the celebration was well worth the trip.
Feainn hael.

The Birke celebration ended a few hours before dawn, so that you and other visitors can tomorrow rise early. You return home, but you and most of the other guests seem to agree that the celebration was well worth the trip.
Feainn hael.
